title: HAAK (by ZhiXiong Huang)
author: squarezero
siteName: TouchArcade - iPhone, iPad, Android Games Forum
text: Staff Member Patreon Silver HAAK 【New DLC Content Update Released!】 Welcome to HAAK, a world brimming with contraptions and dangers. Dangerous mutants wa… Details【New DLC Content Update Released!】 Welcome to HAAK, a world brimming with contraptions and dangers. Dangerous mutants walk the land while dark forces move in the shadows... Rise, Haak, brave wasteland adventurer! Become the light that repels the darkness! Pixel Graphics x Metroidvania x Wasteland World First available on PC and consoles, HAAK is now slaying foes on mobile! -------------------------------------------------------------- Story The game takes place in a world ravaged by disaster. The once glorious city has been reduced to ruins, and the survivors struggle for survival. In the south, a land called Sanho has mostly remained unaffected by the calamity due to its unique geographical environment and has grown into something of a sanctuary. The protagonist, Haak, is a traveler from a small northern town. He chose to leave his home and ventured south to survive. Features • Haak is an explorative game combining action-platformer gameplay with Metroidvania. • Traverse the land with your hook, dash, and charged slash. • Find the multitude of secrets and hidden rooms scattered across the land. • Use any tool at your disposal to master mechanics and solve the multitude of puzzles. • A retro & futuristic pixel world for a comic-esque feel. • Creative difficulty changes so that even those who are all thumbs can beat the hardest of bosses. • Fully hand-drawn graphics with unique and interesting characters. • 10 side missions and areas to explore with plenty of content for over 30 hours of gameplay. • Choose your own path and decide the fates of the game's characters with several possible endings. • Ben Dover will rate you in a variety of aspects after you complete the game. Do you have what it takes to reach the highest rating? If you run into a problem, please contact us at [email protected] with as much information as possible on the issue. TouchArcade Rating:Unrated Compatibility:HD Universal Finally out for real! Staff Member Patreon Bronze Nice! Is this a new app I wonder? Or will I be ok with the one I snagged during the accidental release? Nevermind. All you need to do is update the older version - sweet! Nice I was wondering lately when this was coming back as I remember it got pretty positive feedback here from those that snagged it early. My only concern is I don’t know who the dev is? But I guess if it’s polished already with this kind of game I don’t need to worry about future support for app. Anyone know how the mobile controls are? It looks like a fun time, but I’m a little apprehensive it will be a title I need to have a controller handy to enjoy… Can anyone confirm if it does have controller support? Staff Member Patreon Bronze Confirmed with my Mad Catz controller. Sadly, my Backbone controller is broken or I’d check that too. @W8rd3, I played a good 2 hours using touch and didn’t have any issues. It is one of those games that is always going to feel better using a controller though. At least that’s my opinion. Staff Member Patreon Silver Patreon Gold @Anotherkellydown How did your Backbone break? Staff Member Patreon Silver Patreon Gold Patreon Bronze Oh man, I played the HELL out of this in the original release. To paraphrase myself, I think it’s one of the best games I’ve played this year.I finished it to 100% with touch controls only. It’s doable; does get tough in parts that require precision, but doable. Controller is 100% better though. Although I had a hard time adjusting to the controller at first, after using touch only for a solid week.Yep. I played the original release with a Backbone (which also broke since, see below). I’d assume this rerelease still has controller support.Mine also broke recently. Started with the L1 key not working, and then the left joystick started registering constant ‘down’ movement. So something in the “backbone” broke. I’ll open it up when I have time and see if it can be fixed, but I got a Kishi v2 in the meantime. W8rd3 and ste86uk like this. I’m gonna start this again. Managed to get the pre release version. Loved it. One of the best iOS games I’ve played recently Does it run in fullscreen on iPad mini? Greetz Chris Staff Member Patreon Bronze I’m not 100% sure, but when I took my phone out, I heard the lightning adapter make a quiet crunching noise. Lol. Any time I try it now my character moves automatically down and to the right without any input and no other buttons work. I tried the warranty but I was past my one year by several months. I just can’t bring myself to pay another $100 for one. Maybe when I get some “extra” money. Curious... the update change the icon name to "doomsday"? [Was HAAK when it was released early.] Nope I had the early version and it still said Doomsday Staff Member Patreon Silver Patreon Gold Patreon Bronze It absolutely did not duder. Black icon with HAAK under it. Oh apologies. Mind must be failing me !! Oops Started the game agajn. Love these Metroidvania style games like Haak and my favourite which is Foregone. Love em I only just noticed this is down to £3.99 on sale and I forgot all about it and never did pick it up. But as Dead Cells is one of my favourite games of all time I had to purchase this now. I’m surprised there aren’t more comments for this one but maybe that early released on accident messed up its momentum a bit. Yeah this is a great little game. Shame it didn’t seem more popular. Love it @psj3809 yeh your love for it helped made me really want it back when I missed its early release I remember. Looks like it recently had a big update too. I always like to see a recent update for games even if it’s just bug fixing and optimising so I know it hasn’t just been forgotten. Is this worth it still? On sale for $2.99. Not a love of platforming. Like more action and open like hades, children or Morta. But I of course love Dead Cells. But that is more focused on the action then platform Staff Member Patreon Silver I would say Haak is closer to Dead Cells than to a traditional Mario-style platformer. Keep in in mind that it’s a Metroidvania, so there backtracking involved, and it’s very much story driven, not rogue like. it’s also a very good game . Share This Page
html:
1. Staff Member Patreon Silver

    HAAK

    【New DLC Content Update Released!】 Welcome to HAAK, a world brimming with contraptions and dangers. Dangerous mutants wa…
    Details
    【New DLC Content Update Released!】 Welcome to HAAK, a world brimming with contraptions and dangers. Dangerous mutants walk the land while dark forces move in the shadows... Rise, Haak, brave wasteland adventurer! Become the light that repels the darkness! Pixel Graphics x Metroidvania x Wasteland World First available on PC and consoles, HAAK is now slaying foes on mobile! -------------------------------------------------------------- Story The game takes place in a world ravaged by disaster. The once glorious city has been reduced to ruins, and the survivors struggle for survival. In the south, a land called Sanho has mostly remained unaffected by the calamity due to its unique geographical environment and has grown into something of a sanctuary. The protagonist, Haak, is a traveler from a small northern town. He chose to leave his home and ventured south to survive. Features • Haak is an explorative game combining action-platformer gameplay with Metroidvania. • Traverse the land with your hook, dash, and charged slash. • Find the multitude of secrets and hidden rooms scattered across the land. • Use any tool at your disposal to master mechanics and solve the multitude of puzzles. • A retro & futuristic pixel world for a comic-esque feel. • Creative difficulty changes so that even those who are all thumbs can beat the hardest of bosses. • Fully hand-drawn graphics with unique and interesting characters. • 10 side missions and areas to explore with plenty of content for over 30 hours of gameplay. • Choose your own path and decide the fates of the game's characters with several possible endings. • Ben Dover will rate you in a variety of aspects after you complete the game. Do you have what it takes to reach the highest rating? If you run into a problem, please contact us at [email protected] with as much information as possible on the issue.
    TouchArcade Rating:Unrated
    Compatibility:HD Universal

    Finally out for real!

  2. Staff Member Patreon Bronze

    Nice!

    Is this a new app I wonder? Or will I be ok with the one I snagged during the accidental release?

    Nevermind. All you need to do is update the older version - sweet!

  3. Nice I was wondering lately when this was coming back as I remember it got pretty positive feedback here from those that snagged it early.

    My only concern is I don’t know who the dev is? But I guess if it’s polished already with this kind of game I don’t need to worry about future support for app.

  4. Anyone know how the mobile controls are? It looks like a fun time, but I’m a little apprehensive it will be a title I need to have a controller handy to enjoy…
  5. Can anyone confirm if it does have controller support?

  6. Staff Member Patreon Bronze

    Confirmed with my Mad Catz controller. Sadly, my Backbone controller is broken or I’d check that too.

    @W8rd3, I played a good 2 hours using touch and didn’t have any issues. It is one of those games that is always going to feel better using a controller though. At least that’s my opinion.

  7. Staff Member Patreon Silver Patreon Gold

    @Anotherkellydown How did your Backbone break?

  8. Staff Member Patreon Silver Patreon Gold Patreon Bronze

    Oh man, I played the HELL out of this in the original release. To paraphrase myself, I think it’s one of the best games I’ve played this year.I finished it to 100% with touch controls only. It’s doable; does get tough in parts that require precision, but doable. Controller is 100% better though. Although I had a hard time adjusting to the controller at first, after using touch only for a solid week.Yep. I played the original release with a Backbone (which also broke since, see below). I’d assume this rerelease still has controller support.Mine also broke recently. Started with the L1 key not working, and then the left joystick started registering constant ‘down’ movement. So something in the “backbone” broke. I’ll open it up when I have time and see if it can be fixed, but I got a Kishi v2 in the meantime.
    W8rd3 and ste86uk like this.

  9. I’m gonna start this again. Managed to get the pre release version. Loved it.

    One of the best iOS games I’ve played recently

  10. Does it run in fullscreen on iPad mini?

    Greetz Chris

  11. Staff Member Patreon Bronze

    I’m not 100% sure, but when I took my phone out, I heard the lightning adapter make a quiet crunching noise. Lol. Any time I try it now my character moves automatically down and to the right without any input and no other buttons work. I tried the warranty but I was past my one year by several months. I just can’t bring myself to pay another $100 for one. Maybe when I get some “extra” money.
  12. Curious... the update change the icon name to "doomsday"? [Was HAAK when it was released early.]

  13. Nope I had the early version and it still said Doomsday

  14. Staff Member Patreon Silver Patreon Gold Patreon Bronze

    It absolutely did not duder. Black icon with HAAK under it.

  15. Oh apologies. Mind must be failing me !! Oops

    Started the game agajn. Love these Metroidvania style games like Haak and my favourite which is Foregone. Love em

  16. I only just noticed this is down to £3.99 on sale and I forgot all about it and never did pick it up. But as Dead Cells is one of my favourite games of all time I had to purchase this now.

    I’m surprised there aren’t more comments for this one but maybe that early released on accident messed up its momentum a bit.

  17. Yeah this is a great little game. Shame it didn’t seem more popular. Love it
  18. @psj3809 yeh your love for it helped made me really want it back when I missed its early release I remember.

    Looks like it recently had a big update too. I always like to see a recent update for games even if it’s just bug fixing and optimising so I know it hasn’t just been forgotten.

  19. Is this worth it still? On sale for $2.99. Not a love of platforming. Like more action and open like hades, children or Morta. But I of course love Dead Cells. But that is more focused on the action then platform

  20. Staff Member Patreon Silver

    I would say Haak is closer to Dead Cells than to a traditional Mario-style platformer. Keep in in mind that it’s a Metroidvania, so there backtracking involved, and it’s very much story driven, not rogue like.

    it’s also a very good game .
